intro: Canthium austro-orientale, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and spiny calyces. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a rough texture. Canthium austro-orientale is adapted to thrive in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories.
